epics.title: User Registration and MFA Setup
epics.summary: Implement secure user registration and multi-factor authentication setup.
epics.description: Develop the user registration process that allows customers to create an account and set up multi-factor authentication (MFA) for secure login. This step will involve creating the UI using React, backend logic with Java (Spring Boot), and storing user data in PostgreSQL.

epics.title: Login and Authentication
epics.summary: Develop a secure login system utilizing MFA.
epics.description: Create a secure login system that uses the previously set up multi-factor authentication for additional security. The UI will be built using React, with authentication processes handled by Spring Boot and user details stored in PostgreSQL.

epics.title: Responsive UI Design
epics.summary: Design a responsive user interface for various devices.
epics.description: Design and implement a responsive user interface that provides a consistent user experience across desktop, tablet, and mobile devices using React. The frontend will be optimized for performance and usability.

epics.title: Personalized Dashboard
epics.summary: Develop a personalized dashboard for users.
epics.description: Create a personalized dashboard that displays banking products and services tailored to each userâ€™s profile and eligibility. The dashboard will be implemented using React for the UI, with data fetched from the backend developed in Spring Boot and stored in PostgreSQL.

epics.title: Account Opening and Service Modifications
epics.summary: Implement workflows for account opening and service modifications.
epics.description: Develop streamlined workflows for users to submit account opening requests and service modifications with minimal clicks. The workflows will be managed through the backend in Spring Boot and interact with PostgreSQL for data storage. The UI will be implemented using React.

epics.title: Real-Time Status Updates and Notifications
epics.summary: Implement real-time status updates and email notifications.
epics.description: Develop functionality to provide real-time status updates on user requests and send email notifications regarding their status. This will involve backend processes in Spring Boot and possibly integrating with an email service provider.

epics.title: Interaction History and Secure Data Handling
epics.summary: Maintain a comprehensive user interaction history while ensuring data security.
epics.description: Implement a system to capture and maintain a comprehensive history of user interactions, ensuring all sensitive financial data is stored securely using PostgreSQL. Data security measures will be tightly integrated within the Spring Boot backend.

epics.title: Save and Resume Applications
epics.summary: Allow users to save incomplete applications and resume them later.
epics.description: Implement functionality to allow users to save their incomplete applications and return to finish them later. This will require modifications in both the React frontend and Spring Boot backend, utilizing PostgreSQL to store the application state.

epics.title: Document Upload
epics.summary: Enable users to upload necessary documentation.
epics.description: Develop the functionality for users to upload required documentation directly through the portal. The frontend will use React for the document upload interface, and the backend in Spring Boot will handle the storage and security of the documents in PostgreSQL.

epics.title: Core Banking System Integration
epics.summary: Integrate the portal with the bank's existing core banking system.
epics.description: Implement seamless integration between the new portal and the bank's existing core banking system to ensure data consistency and operational flow. The integration will involve building APIs in Spring Boot that interact securely with both systems.

epics.title: Role-Based Access Control
epics.summary: Implement role-based access control for user authorization.
epics.description: Implement role-based access controls to ensure that users can only view and access services that are appropriate to their profile and authorization level. This includes setting up user roles and permissions in React frontend and enforcing them in the Spring Boot backend.

user_stories.title: Create secure login system with MFA
user_stories.description:
As a user, I want to log in securely using Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) to protect my account with an additional layer of security.

Core Domain Objects:
- Login System
- Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
- User Account

Attributes & Rules:
- Users must provide correct credentials to initiate login.
- System must prompt for MFA code after password verification.
- MFA code must be generated and sent via a secure channel.

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario: Successful login with valid credentials and MFA code
Given the user has valid login credentials
When the user enters their credentials and MFA code
Then the system logs the user in successfully

Scenario: Failed login with invalid credentials
Given the user enters incorrect login credentials
When the user tries to log in
Then the system denies access and shows an appropriate error message

Scenario: Failed login with incorrect MFA code
Given the user enters correct login credentials but an incorrect MFA code
When the user tries to log in
Then the system denies access and shows an appropriate error message

Then the system denies access and shows an appropriate error message

Priority: High - Essential for user account security

Then it should retry the operation a configurable number of times

user_stories.title: Enforce role-based permissions in backend
user_stories.description:
As a backend developer, I want to enforce role-based permissions in the Spring Boot backend, so that users are restricted from accessing unauthorized services.

Core Domain Objects:
- User
- Role
- Permission
- Service

Attributes & Rules:
- Each service should check user's role before execution.
- Unauthorized access attempts should be logged.
- Only permitted roles should be able to access specific services.

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario: Check user role before service execution
Given a user with a specific role tries to access a service
When the service checks the user's role
Then the service should verify if the user has the necessary permissions
And allow or deny access based on the verification

Scenario: Log unauthorized access attempts
Given a user tries to access a service without proper permissions
When the access attempt is denied
Then the service should log the unauthorized access attempt

Scenario: Ensure restricted services are inaccessible for certain roles
Given a user has a limited role
When the user attempts to access a restricted service
Then the service should deny access

- User
- Role
- UI Component
- Page

Attributes & Rules:
- The UI should display only the services the user has permissions for.
- Role-based checks should be made before rendering components.
- Unauthorized components should be hidden or disabled.

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario: Display only permitted services
Given a user with specific roles accesses the frontend
When the UI is rendered
Then only the services allowed by the user's roles should be displayed

Scenario: Hide unauthorized components
Given a user tries to access a component directly
When the component is unauthorized for the user
Then the component should be hidden or display an unauthorized message

Scenario: Disable unauthorized actions
Given a user is on a page with restricted actions
When the user tries to perform the action
Then the action should be disabled or denied
